properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 5 at 9:05AM CST until February 6 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Little Rock AR
properties.description:
...Periods of rain, freezing rain, sleet, and snow expected today
and tonight...

* WHAT...Freezing rain, sleet, and snow.

* WHERE...The higher elevations of Johnson, Newton, and Boone
counties.

* WHEN...9 AM thru midnight tonight.

* ACCUMULATIONS...Minor accumulations of snow up to one quarter
inch will be possible, with locally higher amounts in higher
terrain. A trace to a tenth of an inch of ice accumulation is
anticipated, mainly over higher terrain.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Cold temperatures near the surface will
allow freezing rain to occur, mainly over the higher terrain in
Johnson, Newton, and Boone counties. Freezing rain will
accumulate on trees, power lines, and exposed surfaces. Little
to no ice accumulation on roadways is expected. Up to a quarter
of an inch of snow may fall across the area thru tonight, mixing
with rain, freezing rain, and sleet at times.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of snow...sleet...or
freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for
slippery roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while
driving.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT
